summary:
Chicago is a popular American rock band formed in 1967. Originally known as the Chicago Transit Authority, they shortened their name in 1969. The band's music blends rock, classical, jazz, R&B, and pop.

The original members included Peter Cetera, Terry Kath, Robert Lamm, Lee Loughnane, James Pankow, Walter Parazaider, and Danny Seraphine. Over the years, the lineup changed, with new members joining and some leaving.

Chicago has achieved great success, selling over 100 million records worldwide. They've had many hit songs and albums, and were inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2016.
title: Chicago (band)
